wikipedia_page.main: Albert Edward Terry (born 17 May 1934), also known by the nickname of "Abe", is an English former professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1950s and 1960s. He played at representative level for Great Britain and Lancashire, and at club level for St Helens, Leeds, Featherstone Rovers (Heritage № 430) and Castleford (Heritage № 484) as a prop, i.e. number 8 or 10, during the era of contested scrums.

response: * Abe Terry (born 1934), English rugby league footballer of the 1950s and 1960s

List of Leeds Rhinos international players
response: * Abe Terry won caps for Great Britain while at St. Helens in 1958 against Australia (two matches), in 1959 against France (2 matches), and Australia (3 matches), in 1960 against France, in 1961 against France (2 matches), and while at Leeds in 1962 against France
